The St: Norbert College/Wisconsin Public Radio poll has a history of inaccuracies in previous elections, according to the claim made by Governor Scott Walker.
The recent poll conducted by St: Norbert College and Wisconsin Public Radio did not narrow the group of respondents to likely voters, which reduces the accuracy of the results.
The sample size of the recent poll condu: Norbert College and Wisconsin Public Radio was relatively small (426 adult residents), leading to a larger margin of error.
Another separate poll conducted by Publi: with state voters being evenly divided about recalling Governor Scott Walker, indicating that results can vary depending on the targeted group.
